Description: Foot and floor fragment of East Greek pottery plate or bowl. Flaring ring foot; sinking in inner section of underside of floor. Bands of glaze on underside, foot and outside. Inside glaze and red bands surround a large tondo rosette, much in red.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Hamilton College, Clinton (NY). This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1014)
